message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.NE, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) as it introduces a neural architecture for learning and sequential execution of multiple tasks. It also involves the use of recurrent sub-networks, which are commonly used in machine learning. Additionally, the paper involves the use of reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of machine learning. 

The paper also involves the use of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it aims to improve the efficiency of downstream tasks by accessing previously learned episodic knowledge. 

The paper involves robotics (cs.RO) as it discusses the acquisition of novel skills in the same environment, which is a common goal in robotics research. 

The paper involves the use of neural networks (cs.NE) as it introduces a neural architecture for learning and sequential execution of multiple tasks. 

Finally, the paper involves natural language processing (cs.CL) as it uses the Taxi problem, which involves natural language instructions, as a testbed for the proposed architecture.
